quote: Before the Watermoo race, I had only done two rides that were 100 miles long, and my longest race was 35 miles. Derek Johnson and Karl Kramer from the Sunday Polly Ann A group ride were also racing, so I decided to give it a try, even though I knew I wasn't as good as them.

At 88-miles, THE WATERMOO will be no walk in the park for those looking to get a taste of what makes longer gravel racing so rewarding. Elite riders at the front of the pack competing for the top 5 cash purse will be pushed to their limits to see who becomes the King and Queen of THE WATERMOO.

While there are no podiums for this event (those with the top finish times will have bragging rights!), ALL finishers are rewarded with a colorful aluminum sign with the name of a road from the route that they can proudly display at home.
THE WATERMOO is dedicated to anyone passionate about gravel cycling with a desire to challenge themselves and have fun, whether you are competing or just looking for a great day with friends.
